title: Phillip Schofield tells Phil Vickery to stop swearing as This Morning 'goes off the rails'
text:

Phillip Schofield had to tell Phil Vickery to stop swearing during a foul-mouthed cooking segment.

The TV chef escaped without a warning the first time but was reprimanded for turning the air blue when it happened again in less than a minute.

Phil revealed that he had been filming at Rodda's clotted cream factory in Cornwall and had met Phillip's old school friend.

Explaining what Phillip's school chum told him, Phil said: "Tell me. Why can't that Phillip Schofield get me on that bloody programme?"

Holly Willoughby was left very baffled, while Phillip realised he was speaking about Michael Trivilcock.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Phillip explained that he went to school with Michael, who works in the factory, to a stunned Holly.

Repeating the same quote, TV chef Phil said: "And he said to me 'I can't go on that bloody...'"

Interrupting Phil, horrified Phillip cried: "Stop swearing. Stop it."

Defending his foul-mouthed antics, Phil said: "I'm just really saying what he said to me."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Things got more awkward just a few seconds later when everyone tucked into their Autumn apple strudel.

Strictly Come Dancing star Anton du Beke admitted it was something new to him and he was a massive fan.

Anton said: "Your old chef would be very pleased with you."

(Image: ITV)

Phil quickly pointed out that his mentor was dead, as Anton added: "If he was alive."

Giggling Holly said: "More happy stories."

While Phillip added: "This has gone right off the rails. Suddenly turned very dark."

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: This Morning presenter Phillip admitted the TV chef's Autumn apple strudel segment had 'turned very dark'
